q: Laurence Lovejoy stabbed, beat, poisoned and drowned Waubonsie Valley High School sophomore Erin Justice in Aurora. Justice's mother found the 16-year-old's body in a bathtub of their townhome in March, 2004. He left her to drown in a pool of her own blood, DuPage County Assistant State's Attorney Michael Vick Pawl said during closing arguments Tuesday. Lovejoy, 44, formerly of Naperville, was sentenced to death in 2006, but the appellate court overturned the case amid confusion

will remain co-founder, devoting`` his time and energy to strategic projects,'' Eric Schmidt wrote in a blog post.`` As Google has grown, managing the business has become more complicated,'' Eric Schmidt noted. So Larry, Sergey Brin and I have been talking for a long time how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making-- and over the holidays we decided now was the right moment to make some changes to the way we are structured. There's no reason why a man or woman in this day and age should unexpectedly drop dead of a heart attack. ` Stop the heart, work on it, restart it- good luck,' Robin Williams tells Barbara Walters during the special.( Svennevik/ABC) Robin Williams tells Barbara Walters he's much more grateful for everything.

then-candidate Barack Obama in the 2008 election, but said Sunday on CNN's`` State of the Union'' that he will wait to make a decision on whom to support in the next presidential election. I'm not committed to Barack Obama . I'm not committed to a Republican candidate, Colin Powell told CNN Chief Political Correspondent Candy Crowley .`` I am not committed to any candidate until I see all the candidates and finally see who the two candidates are who are going for this position.''``

: Starting April 4, co-founder Larry Page, becomes CEO and takes over day-to-day operations. Co-founder Sergey Brin will focus on strategic projects, specifically, new products. Eric Schmidt becomes Executive Chairman and will focus externally on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership-all of which are increasingly important given Google's global reach. Internally, Eric Schmidt will continue to act as an advisor to Larry and Sergey Brin .
